wikipedia_page.main: Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne  (5 April 1857 – 29 December 1909) was a British peer and Liberal Party politician.

response: On 5 March 1935, Lord Kintore was married to Delia Virginia Loyd (1915–2007), the only daughter of William Lewis Brownlow Loyd of Upper House and the former Hon. Bettine Henrietta Knatchbull-Hugessen (second daughter of Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne). Together, they were the parents of three children:The Peerage, p. 17301. Accessed 3 January 2015.
* Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne (5 April 1857 – 29 December 1909).
* Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne (1857–1909), British politician
* Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne, (1857–1909), British peer and Liberal Party politician
Knatchbull-Hugesson was born 21 September 1885 on at Norton, Kent the son of Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne.
* Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne, Liberal politician

His paternal grandparents were Governor-General of Australia and Minister for Transport John Baird, 1st Viscount Stonehaven and Ethel Sydney Keith-Falconer, 11th Countess of Kintore. His mother was the only daughter of William Lewis Brownlow Loyd of Upper House and the former Hon. Bettine Henrietta Knatchbull-Hugessen (second daughter of Edward Knatchbull-Hugessen, 2nd Baron Brabourne).
